thread.title: Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation
thread.title_full: Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation

title: Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation Players "suspended from team activities & removed from on-campus housing" pending outcome of late Jan. incident Post to Facebook Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation Players "suspended from team activities & removed from on-campus housing" pending outcome of late Jan. incident Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2k9aifg Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   5 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Three MSU football players suspended amid sexual assault investigation Detroit Free Press Staff Published 5:53 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 | Updated 13 minutes ago An MSU football helmet. (Photo: USA TODAY Sports) 35 CONNECT 5 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Michigan State has suspended three football players while the university conducts an investigation into allegations of a sexual assault complaint last month, the school announced in a news release today. 
MSU Police has been working with the Ingham County Prosecutor’s Office and will forward its reports for review and possible criminal charges. The three MSU players, who were not identified in the release, have been removed from on-campus housing pending the conclusion of the investigation. 
One football staff member also has been suspended by the athletic department. 
MSU also is conducting a Title IX investigation of the sexual assault allegations. Title IX consultant Rebecca Veidlinger will report her findings to the Office of Institutional Equity, according to MSU spokesman Jason Cody. 
No charges have been filed, although Ingham County Prosecutor Carol Siemon confirmed to the Lansing State Journal that her office has been in contact with university police about the investigation and expects to receive its report next week for review. 
MSU’s news release said detectives are interviewing members of the football coaching staff. 
Separate from the criminal and Title IX investigations, the university administration also is using an external law firm to conduct an independent investigation into football program staff members’ compliance with university policy in relation to the allegations. 
“Sexual assault is unacceptable, and members of MSU Athletics who fail to uphold our standards for creating a culture that is safe, supportive, and responsive to those affected by it will be held accountable,” Michigan State athletic director Mark Hollis said in a released statement. “My expectation of all members of the department is full and complete cooperation with all investigations.”
